text:
How come `CartesianIndices(-1:1)` gives
```3-element CartesianIndices{1, Tuple{Base.OneTo{Int64}}}:
 CartesianIndex(1,)
 CartesianIndex(2,)
 CartesianIndex(3,)```
while `CartesianIndices((-1:1,))` gives
```3-element CartesianIndices{1, Tuple{UnitRange{Int64}}}:
 CartesianIndex(-1,)
 CartesianIndex(0,)
 CartesianIndex(1,)```
?

```julia> CartesianIndices(3:5)
3-element CartesianIndices{1, Tuple{Base.OneTo{Int64}}}:
 CartesianIndex(1,)
 CartesianIndex(2,)
 CartesianIndex(3,)```
`3:5` is a vector with length 3, so catesianindices will always give you that regardless what the start and end is
